title: braised shin of beef with hot and sour shredded salad
description: The point of a stew, it should go without saying, is its flavour rather than its form. So, while the crunchy salad strips of carrot, spring onion and pepper do bring colour and beauty to this otherwise brown study, at the same time their texture and Asian-flavoured bite provide the perfect partner for the rich, aromatic spiciness of the soft-braised stew.
ingredients: 5cm/2in piece fresh root ginger, peeled, sliced
250ml/9fl oz Chinese cooking wine (or dry sherry)
2 litres/3½ pints beef stock, preferably organic
3.5kg/7½lb beef shin, on the bone, cut by the butcher into thick slices (or 1kg/2¼lb beef shin off the bone, cut into large cubes)
1 long red chilli, seeds removed, cut into matchsticks
1 long green chilli, seeds removed, cut into matchsticks
